author: Darren Lewis
title: England are international also-rans and MUST raise their game says Gareth Southgate as he names first official squad
text:
Defoe reveals he ignored Southgate's text message before sensational England recall 
Should Walcott channel that into his ­game on a consistent basis, he too could be back. 
Southampton’s James Ward-Prowse and West Brom’s Jake Livermore are proof that Southgate’s England will opt for graft instead of glamour. 
And although both Luke Shaw and Marcus Rashford are not getting anywhere near enough game time at ­Manchester United, Southgate knows the pair can be serial thrillers for his new-look team. 
His reign begins when ­England visit Germany for a friendly on Wednesday before a World Cup qualifier against Lithuania at Wembley four days later. 
For Southgate, those games will kick off his search for ­leaders and answers to why our stars have failed to transfer their Premier League and European form on to the world stage. England's last knockout round win at a World Cup or Euros — ELEVEN years ago (Photo: Popperfoto) Read More BRIAN READE: Labelling England players world-class is Donald Trump-level 'fake news' brainwashing 
He added: “I’m ­excited by the challenge and determined not to leave any stone unturned in trying to ­improve the way we work and the level of ­performance. I want to speak to the ­players about the fact we always talk about what we’d like to achieve, but don’t look at the reality of where we are. 
“We’ve won three knockout games since 1990, and the last one was in 2006. 
"Whatever we think we are as a nation, we’ve not been delivering. We seem to have won medals in almost every other sport. What drives me is the need to start recognising where we are and how to bridge the gap. 
“Sometimes we get wrapped up in the profile of our league, as we are seeing at the moment. Southgate's notorious saved penalty meant Euro 96 semi-final heartache... (Photo: Allsport/Getty) ...and England haven't come as close to winning a trophy in the 20 years since (Photo: Getty) Read More Southgate won't give players time off during international break after Rooney controversy 
"Eight or 10 years ago we were always involved in Champions League semi-finals and finals. That isn’t the case anymore. 
“There’s a harsh lens needed on some of the things we are doing. We need to look at who the top teams are and work out how we get to their level. 
“I was in a team that made a semi-final and it has happened once since 1990. Twice since 1966. 
"It’s my job to analyse what hasn’t been right and then show the lads a pathway. And we need to be pretty brutal about it.” poll loading Will England win the Euros or World Cup in your lifetime? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
